GM advice for themes and plots to help you get the most out of using Archbliss in your game
boardgame.rpgsetting: Sundara: Dawn of a New Age

boardgame.name: The Last Torch
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Last Torch is a game about the end of your world, eternal darkness and the last moments of a few survivors gathered around their last light source.

TLT is heavily inspired by Ten Candles, but does a few things differently:

This is a GM-less game.

Shadows, Mandalas and Obstacles are used as mechanic.

It is not as scary and resolves more about finding the flow of a narrative together.

boardgame.name: Nightbreak
boardgame.description:
Nightbreak is a medium weight competitive hero-based fantasy card game that features a fixed turn count, a day/night resource system, spatial positioning mechanics, and push your luck mechanics.

Players choose three Heroes from their faction and enter a battle with a duration of two in-game days. During each player's turn, that player gains at least one Blessing Point from their Goddess. Blessing Points are resources used to activate Hero powers. These resources also allow Heroes to escape from the battle undetected, or allow Heroes to pray to their Goddess for further blessings on a future turn.

As the battle progresses, Heroes take damage and eventually become overwhelmed forcing them to temporarily retire from the battle. When a Hero becomes overwhelmed, a new Hero from that player's Hero deck arrives to the battle. The player who overwhelms an opposing Hero gains favor from their Goddess. At the end of the two-day battle, the player that earned the most favor from their Goddess is the winner!

boardgame.name: Holy Animals
boardgame.description:
Holy Animals is a social deduction game about a group of Animal Gods coming to your village. Players acting as villagers must take turns serving the right food to Animal Gods appearing each round. However, food is scarce in the village, so you might not always have the right food to serve. You must sometimes sneak in other things in order to live another day. If you get caught by other people you will be punished, but if you catch them lying you will be rewarded. It's a game of deception, bluffing, and survival.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Qixit
boardgame.description: The object of the game is to form as many vertical and horizontal words as possible within 6 minutes... or whatever time the players wish to set. -From the back of the box.

boardgame.name: Altenor Secrets
boardgame.description:
Altenor Secrets is a game of competitive clashes. Guilds of adventurers and champions compete in the depths of a tower in perpetual motion. To win, you have to manage several parameters. This board game has a well-developed lore, integrates video game dynamics and characters worthy of miniature games.

You play in circular sections within a level of the endless tower of Altenor, you control a team whose purpose is to defeat the opposing player’s team by bluffing, gaining access to key areas and controlling magical artifacts, called atoriums, to your advantage.

The sections have been converted into arenas by guilds and dynasties but are still in motion during the game. Beware, the rings you are on will be moving!

Each ring is composed of 8 areas representing grand halls with specific rules. The board center is occupied by a NEXUS, a node of power deep in the tower of Altenor.

Each player moves their characters alternatively. You activate a character to bring him to life and perform regular and free actions. Each of your 6 characters has a specific role to play that comes with advantages and drawbacks.

Move through grand halls each with their own surprises. Be clever when taking everything into account and try gaining a tactical advantage towards victory.

There are 6 different ways to score points, and 4 rounds for you to overtake your opponent. The player whose team scored the largest number of points at the end of the game wins the match!

Your guild is relying on you.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition)
boardgame.description:
The Age of Sigmar began with the thunderous arrival of the Stormcast Eternals, borne upon the heavenly storm of the God-King Sigmar Heldenhammer. They are great heroes, snatched up at the moment of death and magically reforged – these golden warriors are thrown into battle against all who would corrupt, decay, and destroy the Mortal Realms.

While Sigmar and his pantheon of Order strive for prosperity in these dark times, the Great Necromancer Nagash marshals the forces of Death in a bid to claim every last soul for his own. Meanwhile, Kragnos leads the wild forces of Destruction in a savage rampage across the civilised world, all while the Chaos Gods prepare to conquer the last uncorrupted bastions in a world of conflict and upheaval. This is a new epoch, a time of mighty battles and unending war. This is the Age of Sigmar!

The Age of Sigmar is an epic setting populated by myriad armies, powerful heroes, and magnificent monsters. It plays host to vast, realm-spanning wars between the forces of Order, Chaos, Death, and Destruction. In the Warhammer Age of Sigmar Core Book, you’ll not only learn the rich history of this war-torn age, but you’ll also find all the rules you need to evoke these epic stories on the tabletop.

Realms of War

The Core Book starts with Realms of War, an overview of the Warhammer hobby with concise how-to guides on collecting, building, and painting your miniatures, as well as the various ways you can use them to play games of Warhammer Age of Sigmar.

War Unending

Discover the history of the Mortal Realms in the first lore section of the book, containing a detailed, illustrated story-so-far, from the arrival of mankind's God-King to the savage Era of the Beast. This covers three major ages:


The Age of Myth, Sigmar’s journey through the cosmos, his meeting with the Great Drake Dracothion and his exploration of the eight Mortal Realms. It tells of his awakening of other gods, the building of civilisations, and the fractious alliances that were forged.



The Age of Chaos, brought about by the machinations of the Chaos Gods and their command of the Realm of Chaos, spitting daemon legions forth and destroying the peace that once reigned.



The Age of Sigmar, in which the God-King's champions fight back against his enemies in all their forms. From the vengeful Realmgate Wars that cast Chaos back from many Order strongholds, to the cataclysmic Necroquake brought about by Nagash, God of the Dead, to the dawn of the Era of Beasts as the ancient Earthquake God unleashes hordes of rampaging greenskins into the heartlands of civilisation.


Delve into background information on each of the eight Mortal Realms – Azyr, Shyish, Ashqy, Chamon, Ghur, Ghyran, Hysh, and Ulgu – which details their links, descriptions of the native civilisations that have risen and fallen, key events that have taken place and notable geographical features; along with details of the Realm of Chaos, a nightmarish dimension home to the Chaos Gods and legions of terrifying hellspawn.

Clashing Empires

Learn about the armies and alliances that fight across the Mortal Realms, each featuring a showcase of beautifully painted Citadel miniatures, split into four sections according to their Grand Alliances. Beginning with the forces of Order, you'll glean insight into each of the factions that comprise the last bastion of civilisation in the eight realms (even if they don't always get along), before moving on to parley with their nemeses in the forces of Chaos. Meanwhile, Nagash's alliance of Death plots to claim every last soul in the land, while Grand Alliance Destruction indulges their baser instincts on a roaring rampage of carnage alongside their newfound deity, Kragnos.

The Rules

The first rules section of this book contains the core concepts you need to start fighting battles in the Age of Sigmar, taking you through deployment, the battle rounds, combat, magic, and more. The rules are laid out in a clear and concise format with additional commentary from the designers, making this the easiest rulebook to reference in Warhammer history.

Once you've got the basics squared away, find out all about the three core ways to play the game and the battleplans you can undertake in each.

Open Play
Let your imagination run wild as open play caters for re-enacting every kind of narrative storyline or tactical challenge you can think of, without restrictions.

Includes the Open War Battleplan Generator, which provides pre-set Maps, Victory Conditions, Twists, and Ruses.
Combining different options allows over 1,200 different types of Open War scenarios to be played.


Matched Play
Designed to put both players on an equal footing, matched play offers players an even chance of victory based around points-based army construction rules and a competitive set of battleplans.

Includes additional special rules, including Stealing the Initiative, as well as rules for additional objectives scored on either a turn-by-turn or end-of-battle basis.
Features much broader and more detailed requirements and restrictions than other game types, including restrictions on endless spells, reinforced units, and understrength units.


Narrative Play
Send your army on a Path to Glory and watch them develop across games with an overhauled section on narrative gameplay rules. Earn renown, gain new abilities, and even expand your army's territory while free of limitations on how, when, and where you can play.
– Includes rules and guidance on a 5-step process to starting a Path to Glory campaign, including: Choosing Factions and Realms, Starting Sizes and Territories, Orders of Battle, Core Enhancements, and picking Quests to embark upon.
– Provides guidance on how to fight battles against opponents both participating and not participating in a Path to Glory Campaign.

Conquest Unbound

The final section helps represent the vast array of battlefields and endless war that the overlords of the Mortal Realms fight across, including bespoke rules for the various, more niche type of battlefields you may come to fight, on, across, over, or indeed, under.

It includes three variant types of games for players to enjoy, including:


Siege Warfare – all too often across the Mortal Realms, warlords and conquerors look to displace inhabitants of a territory or city that they have decided should fall under their control, and often the culmination of such a campaign is a brutal, no-holds-barred siege.



Triumph and Treachery – sometimes duty calls for an all-out brawl between all of your enemies at once, and, when that happens, these rules can be used to represent battles that take place between three or more factions at the same time – all are frantically fighting to win the day against all other opponents, but will you be the one to come out on top?



Tunnel Fighting – deadly, close-quarters combat is commonplace across the Mortal Realms as armies cluster into labyrinthine cave networks, perfidious skaven skitter through the city sewers, and mind-bending tunnels open up in the unpredictable domains of Chaos.


The Core Book closes out with a handy, alphabetised rules index and a photocopiable Path to Glory roster, Order of Battle, and Army roster.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition) : Chaos Battletome – Skaven
Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Arena of Shades
Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Chaos Battletome – Maggotkin of Nurgle
Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Destruction Battletome – Orruk Warclans
Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Dominion
Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Echoes of Doom
Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Fury of the Deep
Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Order Battletome – Fyreslayers
Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Order Battletome – Idoneth Deepkin
Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Order Battletome – Stormcast Eternals
Warhammer Age of Sigmar General's Handbook Pitched Battles 2021
Warhammer Age of Sigmar General's Handbook Pitched Battles 2022-23 Season 1
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition) Core Rules

listing.notes:
Warhammer Age of Sigmar - DOMINION
Language: English Condition: New shrink-wrapped
SHIPPING COSTS send me message
German Version, core rulebook, hardbound

boardgame.name: Botched Born
boardgame.description:
From the description:

You can’t even die right. Someone tried, sentenced, and executed you. But you were born again from your half-finished death. You robbed your own grave for a secondhand life, shambled on by rage, thirst, and acidic hope. Death misplaced you. You choose torture over peace. A new life from a botched death.

boardgame.name: Titanothae Rising
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Published under the OGL and compatible with 5e and OSR fantasy role playing games, SHOTGLASS ADVENTURES – Kal-Zar’s Bane 3: TITANOTHAE RISING is a 124-page book with adventures for characters of 8th-10th level, that can be played as One-Shots or as the third module in a four-part campaign. It's the sequel to Gravis Town Blues and Mined Games, but can be played separately from those titles or as a continuation of the story.

So, what’s in SHOTGLASS ADVENTURES – Kal-Zar’s Bane 3: TITANOTHAE RISING?

7 full adventures - for characters from 8th – 10th level! The adventures include murder mystery, investigation, infiltration, rescue and dungeon crawls! Designed for flexible delivery, each can be run as part of the ongoing Kal-Zar’s Bane campaign, or as a One-Shot. Every adventure has both Campaign-specific and One-Shot-specific hooks. The One-Shot hooks ignore the campaign so you can run each adventure as a one-off for your players - slot them into your existing campaign or run them as separate, individual side quests!
Loads of hand-drawn, full-color maps - towns, castles, villages and dungeons!
28 new monsters & NPCs, including Scorch Spiders, Orc Steelclaws and the massive Tendrils of Asgarte!
17 new magic items, including the Gnomish Clockforged Battlesuit, The Vostok (a flying longship) and the mammoth Titanothae!
Towns, villages and region settings included – Gravis Town, Fort Orinsfire, Holdover Village, the Orinwood Forest and the Frozen North!
Expanded Lore + Map of Verona Province (including the Frozen North) - expanded lore for the world of the Invician Empire and Verona Province, the frontier setting for Shotglass Adventures!
Guide for running the adventures with OSR systems!

boardgame.name: Paperback Adventures: Damsel
boardgame.description:
As the Damsel, you can have exciting Paperback Adventures alone or with a friend.

Paperback Adventures Character Box

There will be distress. And she will cause it.


More aggressive playstyle
Hex counters deal ramping poison damage
Use every letter in your hand for a critical hit
Sneak attack enemies at key moments


As long as you have at least one character box, the core box contains everything else you need to play the game. The core box also has space to store the bonus content from each of your character boxes (note: not all content from those boxes), allowing you to set up a new game more quickly.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: There Once Were Dragons Compendium 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product collects the material previously published in the Companion volume 6-12.

This accessory for There Once Were Dragons, the roleplaying game of epic fantasy action, introduces a wealth of new material to enrich your game:

23 new monsters, including Greater Drakes, Two-Headed Dragons and K'zzakk Sraass, a level 200 demon lord.
28 new uncommon, rare, exotic and legendary magical items.

boardgame.name: Fantastic Careers: OOPS! All Reactions
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Reactions are a beloved element of the Pathfinder Second Edition action economy. Who doesn’t love stopping the monster in its tracks and disrupting what would have been a devastating action? But reactions are also situational. It can be difficult to gauge how much mileage your PC will get out of that reaction feat. The PC archetypes presented in this book will help you find something to do with your reaction nearly every round of combat – and help you gain an extra reaction when you just don’t have enough! Regardless of your character build or play style, the Fantastic Careers series provides options to advance your characters along their unique journeys!

boardgame.name: Hina Amano & Becca Quest
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

As technology becomes increasingly advanced and expensive to develop, governments and corporations around the world seek the quickest ways to stay ahead of, or at least on par with, their peers and rivals. This often requires the expenditure of vast sums of money. At other times, however, the most affordable shortcut to acquiring new technology involves stealing it from someone else. The threat of the theft of high-tech secrets has forced companies and governments to do everything possible to protect those secrets. They employ state-of-the-art security systems, use the most advanced encryption methods possible, hire legions of guards, and even employ super-powered individuals. Regrettably, in a world where people can turn invisible, phase through walls, or mentally infiltrate computer networks, such security efforts often fall short.

This PDF contains everything you need to know about the Mosaic Trust members, Hina Amano & Becca Quest, in the Amazing Universe Campaign or any other superhero campaign.
boardgame.rpgseries: Official Handbook of the Amazing Universe

boardgame.name: Rol Crusaders
boardgame.description:
User Summary

As a part of the Templar Order you tries to fight the Devil whom have a pact with the powerful inquisitor Belasco, trying to seize Templar secrets, including the Holy Ark of the Covenant.

boardgame.name: Paperback Adventures: Ex Machina
boardgame.description:
As Ex Machina, you can have exciting Paperback Adventures alone or with a friend.

Paperback Adventures Character Box

The ending will come. But not how you expect.


More defensive playstyle
Heal damage if you have enough boon counters
Charge your laser over time for a big blast
Damage yourself for stronger card abilities


As long as you have at least one character box, the core box contains everything else you need to play the game. The core box also has space to store the bonus content from each of your character boxes (note: not all content from those boxes), allowing you to set up a new game more quickly.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sanctum Secorum (Issue #43 - Jun 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Campaign Tools
1d50 Parallel Universes - Daniel J. Bishop
My Carnelian Cube is a WHAT?! - Daniel J. Bishop
This One Time at the Tavern… - Daniel J. Bishop

Monsters
Rhodelephas Phantasms - Bob Brinkman
Zoroastrian Cephalopods - Bob Brinkman

Reviews
At the Mountains of Loudness - Bob Brinkman

Spells
Make Potion (Spell Expansion) - Bob Brinkman
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
Mutant Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Sanctum Secorum (Issue #43b - DCC Day 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A compiled collection of creative classes and background materials to enrich your DCC RPG table. This libram contains 27 new classes and 6 character background articles to bring things to life.

Barbarians, Nu-Men, Subhumans, and so much more!
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Our Lady of Faces
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Blessed Doom That Walks: Our Lady of Faces is a system-agnostic compendium containing one in a series of seven demigods for use with RPGs. Our Lady of Faces is inspired by the death goddesses of the world and a concept called an “Angel maker” and works best in the context of fantasy, or a comparative setting to European medieval to early 18th century technology and culture.

boardgame.name: Zuar
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Races of Center Space 5: Zuar is the newest volume in a series playable races for the 5th Edition rules of the world's most popular role-playing game.

This volume presents the Zuar—a species of natural empaths who excel at deception.

Each race in the series is from the Center Space setting. While Center Space is a science fiction setting, the races can easily be used with other genres.

This book contains the racial traits and a new racial feat for the Zuar.

boardgame.name: Kingdoms of Africa
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kingdoms of Africa is an expansion of the campaign world presented in the Pax Lexque Campaign Guide. The Pax Lexque campaign world is an alternate reality earth in which the history of our own world is co-mingled with common elements of a fantasy setting. This book may be used in conjunction with the Pax Lexque Campaign Guide or it may stand on its own.

This guide is meant as a sandbox environment. Sixteen nations of the continent of Africa are presented with their geography, lore and culture, providing an environment for characters to explore. The guide contains eighteen new patrons, five of which are presented in full detail, complete with patron spells. Also included is the new character class, the Shaman.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Paperback Adventures: Plothook
boardgame.description:
As Plothook the Pirate, you can have exciting Paperback Adventures alone or with a friend.

Paperback Adventures Character Box


Word-heavy playstyle
Barrage cards get bonuses for longer words
Can drain the enemy's life!
Can copy the effect of an item – effectively using it twice
Crew cards come back from the fatigue pile


As long as you have at least one character box, the core box contains everything else you need to play the game. The core box also has space to store the bonus content from each of your character boxes (note: not all content from those boxes), allowing you to set up a new game more quickly.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Elven Town (2.0 - PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of your towns and cities being boring, bland places in which your PCs show little or no interest? Want to bring them alive with cool, interesting minor features of note? Then Urban Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different kind of town and gives harried GMs the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and noteworthy features.

This instalment of Urban Dressing presents loads of great details to customise the elven towns in your campaign.

This Urban Dressing presents:
One table (100 entries) presenting the town's sights and sounds.
One table (100 entries) presenting sample businesses.
One table (100 entries) presenting folk to encounter around town.
One table (20 entries) presenting hooks, complications and opportunities.

From publisher blurb:

boardgame.description:

Then Urban Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different kind of town and gives harried GMs the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and noteworthy features.

This instalment of Urban Dressing presents loads of great details to customise the dwarven holds in your campaign.

This Urban Dressing presents:
One table (100 entries) presenting the town's sights and sounds.
One table (100 entries) presenting sample businesses.
One table (100 entries) presenting folk to encounter around town.
One table (20 entries) presenting hooks, complications and opportunities.

boardgame.name: Dwarven Hold (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of your towns and cities being boring, bland places in which your PCs show little or no interest? Want to bring them alive with cool, interesting minor features of note? Then Urban Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different kind of town and gives harried GMs the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and noteworthy features.

This instalment of Urban Dressing presents loads of great details to customise the dwarven holds in your campaign.

This Urban Dressing presents:
One table (100 entries) presenting the town's sights and sounds.
One table (100 entries) presenting sample businesses.
One table (100 entries) presenting folk to encounter around town.
One table (20 entries) presenting hooks, complications and opportunities.

boardgame.name: Dwarven Hold (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of your towns and cities being boring, bland places in which your PCs show little or no interest? Want to bring them alive with cool, interesting minor features of note? Then Urban Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different kind of town and gives harried GMs the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and noteworthy features.

This instalment of Urban Dressing presents loads of great details to customise the dwarven holds in your campaign.

This Urban Dressing presents:
One table (100 entries) presenting the town's sights and sounds.
One table (100 entries) presenting sample businesses.
One table (100 entries) presenting folk to encounter around town.
One table (20 entries) presenting hooks, complications and opportunities.

boardgame.name: Bad Night in El Rey
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your gang just stole a safe from the bank in a silver mining town. Your group of dangerous outlaws has a rendezvous with a safecracker in a backwater burg called El Rey, where you aim to lie low until sun-up. Somehow, things just don't feel right. Can you trust your pards? Can you live through the night?

Bad Night in El Rey is a convention-style Western with a weird twist. This scenario uses DHR’s Fort Griffin setting, for Savage Worlds. While Bad Night in El Rey borrows from Fort Griffin Savaged, this scenario takes place in its own locale with its own backstory. If you are already using Fort Griffin as a setting, you can play El Rey as a one time lark, or adapt the adventure to your game.

boardgame.name: Sewer Losers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Arnyn, a merfolk mercenary, has been hired to clean out the sewers below a thriving port city. Unfortunately, she jumped at the payday before truly understanding what she was being asked to do. Now she's looking for someone to take over her contract.

Includes

A short adventure for 4-5 characters of 2nd to 4th level
A map of the sewers
Stat blocks for all monsters
Jumping off points for potential future adventures

boardgame.name: Desperately Seeking Plumb Gorgeous
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Granny Gristletit’s House of Forbidden Pleasure is one of only a few active businesses on the Buzzard’s Gulch Monster Reservation, Located in the southern portion of that barren plot of ground, not far from the Dysentarium Swamp, and a stone’s throw from the Rough House Fight Club, the brothel caters mostly to the few resident monsters who have managed to obtain money or power. Its location is an old, crumbling church, left to rot when humans abandoned the stretch of land that would become the reservation.

Granny the witch hag takes pride in being able to offer the most unusual and rare specimens of harlot (both male and female). Her “attractions include Corpsina the zombie girl, who wears a scold’s bridle to keep her from biting, Madam M’Gruff the dog faced lady, Massive Mike the hobgoblin, Calista the lamia, and Evard Blue Tentacles the talktipus. But one thing has thus far eluded the old hag’s search for the most unusual of floozies: a human virgin of stunning beauty. Granny won’t settle for just any old virgin, her mirror has told her all: the sweetest, kindest, most feminine, most beautiful girl in all of Hylax is Plumb Gorgeous.

Unfortunately for Granny, Plumb Gorgeous, orphaned at an early age, now resides in a castle in Gnarlian’s Wood, guarded by the nine Gnomes of Renown. Because of the powers of Gnarlian, Granny cannot obtain the girl through magic, nor go to Gnarlian’s Wood herself. The magical laws laid out at the end of the Monster Wars are binding. Granny needs bold and ambitious monsters who can go to Gnarlian’s Wood for her, kidnap the girl, and bring her back in one piece. Granny can supply a map to Cannalot Castle in Gnarlian’s Wood where Plumb Gorgeous is said to pass her days chatting with birds, and sewing the beautiful gowns she loves to cavort in. “I used to go there… to Cannalot... in my younger days,” Granny says wistfully.

boardgame.name: L'échappée Infernale
boardgame.description:
L'échappée Infernale: Race tactics and strategy

Become sports manager and target your objectives according to your team (puncher, sprinter, climber) and the route (plain, hilly, medium and high mountain).
Set the record straight:

Jump on the right breakaway, The Infernal Breakaway, the one that will bring you to the finish line.
Manage your energy capital as a great tactician:
Here is the red flame of the last kilometer, already the finish line ... Start the sprint ... Watch out for falls ... victory will be played with one wheel ...
Once you have crossed the finish line, it's time to do the math: Calculate the time of your runners and their places in the general classification.


For this new edition, the game has been modernized: The old Cofalu riders have been replaced for some much more modern-looking specially designed for this game. The board has changed too. Now it features different sections for high mountain (red), medium mountain (pink), up-and-downs (yellow) and plain (blue).

The rules have changed too. Now they are a little more complex. We have different kinds of riders (climber, sprinter, "puncheur") and consequently we also have different types of terrains, four different types in fact (In the 2001 version of the game all riders were similar and there was only a climb in the board).

boardgame.name: Lions of Lydia: Metal Coins
boardgame.description: Set of 24 metal "Lion" coins (12 Silver ones and 12 Gold threes), contained in a white faux velvet drawstring bag with a golden "Lion" coin embroidered on the outside. Part of the "Deluxe" pledge level during the 2020 Kickstarter campaign and packaged outside the sealed game box.

boardgame.name: Casus Belli (v4, Issue 34 - Jul/Aug 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Casus Belli continue sa marche en avant ! Il est désormais disponible en boutique de jeux spécialisées dans un format mook (à mi-chemin entre le livre et le magazine).

Dans ce numéro 34 de Casus Belli, spécial anniversaire de 272 pages, vous trouverez :

l'actualité des jeux de rôle,
les critiques (L'Oeil Noir, Trudvang, Chosen Ones, Dearg, Nouveau Monde, La Division du Commandement....)
les scénarios (Héros & Dragons, L'Oeil Noir, Les Oubliés, L'Appel de Cthulhu)
les aides de jeu (Funtasy, Bâtisses & Artifices : la maison de commerce, les PJ et MJ Only...)
les articles rétro (Aeon, Birthright)
la zone magazine spéciale anniversaire (des entretiens avec Froidval, Sfar, des hommages à Devine qui vient diner ce soir et au magazine Casus Belli sans oublier le billet de l'odieux connard...)
et bien sûr nos BD : le Club Casus, Donjon Service, etc.

boardgame.name: Casus Belli (v4, Issue 35 - Nov/Dec 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Casus Belli continue sa marche en avant ! Il est désormais disponible en boutique de jeux spécialisées dans un format mook (à mi-chemin entre le livre et le magazine).

Dans ce numéro 35 de Casus Belli, spécial anniversaire de 272 pages, vous trouverez :

l'actualité des jeux de rôle,
les critiques (Würm, L'Empire des cerisiers, Torg Eternity, Lore & Legacy, Adventures in Austérion, Tecumah Gulch, Cthulhu Mythos, Abstract Donjon Steampunk...)
les scénarios (Héros & Dragons, Star Wars, Savage Worlds, Achtung! Cthulhu, Trudvang Chronicles, CO Fantasy)
les aides de jeu ((Le consentement en jeu, Bâtisses & Artifices : le barrage des jours, les PJ et MJ Only...)
les articles rétro (Chateau Falkenstein, The Whispering Vault)
la zone magazine (des entretiens avec Lucien Maine, Bruce Heard sans oublier le billet de l'odieux connard...)
et bien sûr nos BD : le Club Casus, Donjon Service, etc.

boardgame.name: Casus Belli (v4, Issue 36 - Feb/Mar 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

En quelques mots : Casus Belli continue sa marche en avant ! Il est désormais disponible en boutique de jeux spécialisées dans un format "mook" (à mi-chemin entre le livre et le magazine).
Dans ce numéro 36 de Casus Belli, vous trouverez :

l'actualité des jeux de rôle,
les critiques (Laelith, Capitaine Vaudou, L'Appel de Cthulhu, Pax Elfica, Monstres, Starfinder Boîte d'initiation, Nibiru, Labyrinthe, Rotting Christ, Tales from the loop boîte d'initiation, etc.)
les scénarios (Héros & Dragons, Star Wars, Runequest, CO Fantasy)
les aides de jeu (Bâtisses & Artifices : L'académie tolérée, Mythic Battles Pantheon, Jeu complet : Un party boy, une carte, les PJ et MJ Only...)
les articles rétro (Everway)
la zone magazine (reportage Laelith en vrai, des entretiens avec Christophe Béchu et Michael Goldman, sans oublier le billet de l'odieux connard...)
et bien sûr nos BD : le Club Casus, Donjon Service, etc.
boardgame.rpg: Jim Henson's Labyrinth: The Adventure Game
Monstres: Le jeu de rôle dans l'univers de Sfar

boardgame.name: Death or Glory: Das Erbe von Morgan
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Turn based strategy game with some roleplay elements.

boardgame.name: Warlock! Black Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Warlock! is a rules-light roleplaying game that aims to emulate the feeling of old-school British tabletop games of wondrous and fantastical adventure. Warlock looks to reproduce the play style of its illustrious predecessors but in a light, quick and simple manner, with a consistent rule-set that is easily hackable and adaptable as desired.

This exclusive, limited edition, not only contains the complete core rules, but for the first time it presents in a single volume the setting book Kingdom, as well as some rules from the popular Compendium II, as well as tons of all-new art, new layout, many fixes and corrections, and even an all-new character sheet!

Within the pages of Warlock! - Black Edition you will find:

A complete ruleset, easy enough for new players but flexible and interesting enough for veterans.
Dozens of interesting character choices and careers. Who doesn’t want to play as a ratcatcher?
Flexible and engaging combat and magic rules.
A Gazetteer of the Evening Lands, the western part of the Kingdom, the official setting for Warlock!, with a focus on Grim Biskerstaf, a thriving port city on the mighty river Vessen.
Advice on how to run the game, and many adventure ideas to get you started!


This an exclusive collector’s edition, limited to 200 hand-numbered copies. A free PDF is included.

Hardcover bound in faux leather with the Wizard head embossed in gold foil on the cover
Luxurious hard slipcase bound in red cloth
Amazingly illustrated end-papers
Hand-sewn spine with ribbon bookmark

boardgame.name: The Bugs Bunny Hare-Brained Adventure
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Travel around in mazes as Bugs Bunny to escape a tower full of dangerous traps.

boardgame.name: Penumbra
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A planet poisoned by its people’s lifeline. The people’s need for just a few more drops of that poison. A remote, dangerous chance to discover a new reserve. As a member of a team of disposable drillers left alone on an asteroid to take that chance, the hope for your home colony that you lost long ago is now dwindling what little hope you reserved for yourself. If you can just find and secure this last energy source, it may let them live a few decades longer, but more importantly, you could earn enough money to leave this place far behind before you have to watch it destroy itself…

Penumbra is a contemplative one-shot adventure for Jesse Ross’s Trophy Dark in which the players, a rag-tag group of burnt-out Sap drillers forced into the role of last-minute heroes, will struggle to cross a desolate asteroid and add a few final grains of sand to the Colony's proverbial hourglass. A bleak and lonely exploration of whether to fight the end, this book contains all of the rules you need to play, including all-new character creation options.

Theme: Recurrence
The book is 32 pages long. It includes:

4 new occupations and 6 new backgrounds, drives, and rituals for character creation
15 moments
10 conditions

boardgame.name: The Pried Eye
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Once, this backwoods town only whispered about the sordid histories of its rare newcomers and the abundant setbacks of its long-time residents. But a brilliant flash in the sky a few nights back has brought new topics to the hushed tones of worried recluses and nosy neighbors: odd shapes along the treeline, mysterious lights deeper within, and notes pleasant to the ear dancing on the wind. You’ve heard more enticing rumors, though, those of priceless gems unlike any other, ripe for the taking, and your thoughts can’t escape the tinge of colors you’ve never witnessed before, strange but welcoming, emanating unseen from the woods that were once your childhood playground…

The Pried Eye is a one-shot adventure for Jesse Ross’s Trophy Dark in which the crash of something spectacular and indescribable in the backwoods of rural 20th-century America will lead to the players hunting for otherworldly gems, hoping to seize their independence and break free from their small town’s lack of opportunity. A tense and eerie descent into body horror, cosmic weirdness, and ego-murder focusing on the theme of communion, this book contains all of the rules you need to play, including all-new character creation options.

Theme: Communion
The book is 28 pages long and has a lot of evocative artwork. It includes:

4 new occupations and 6 new backgrounds, drives, and rituals for character creation
15 moments
10 conditions

boardgame.name: E.S.S.
European Space Simulator
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Manage a space shuttle trip set in 2010

boardgame.name: E.S.S Mega
ESS Mega
European Space Simulator Mega
boardgame.description:
Back of box

Construct a space station

Kit the shuttle

Plot in full 3D and go out on

Ask for blast-off

Land on the Corporation's shuttle-carrier

Consult History of Man in Space...
'...amazing video sequeneces (200 MB) and HI-FI music (300 MB) (CD versions only)

boardgame.name: Bernpyle #5 "Fienkrieger" (June 2021)
boardgame.description:
publisher summary
Bernpyle #5 Is an unofficial Mausritter zine and it is packed full of fun content. This zine features a hack of Emmy Allen's amazing Gardens of Ynn. It also contains a hack of TorTheVic's Carapace. Learn the history of the Maus and Fae conflicts. Play as a Faerie Outcast, a Fienkrieger. Explore the vast unknown of the Feylands. Bernpyle #5 feature loads of public domain faerie art and has been a pet project of mine. I am excited to release this fun and magical addition to your Mausritter campaign.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: History of the Faeries and Mice

boardgame.name: Danskernes Egen Historie
boardgame.description: A trivia game in the vein of Trivial Pursuit, featuring photos from 20th century Danish history.

boardgame.name: Super Dungeon: Masterclass – Krampus
boardgame.description:
With a strength of 3B 2G and a will of 2R 2G, Krampus is well-equipped to destroy any Hero. It has a lower armor than most dungeon bosses, but this is compensated for with its abilities.

You’ve Been Naughty shapeshifts any Hero that scores a critical against him into a Naughtie, turning his low armor into a potential asset as Heroes are more likely to score criticals. Once some Heroes have been transformed, Nom Nom Nom! allows the Krampus to heal whenever he destroys a Naughtie.

The first action available to Krampus is Into The Bag. This devastating attack renders the target Immobile and Hexed, making its next activation difficult as it struggles to move or attack (it’s hard to move when you’re stuck in a sac, after all).

The next action is the Grabbing Stick, which allows Krampus to move the target with compel, potentially setting it up to perform an attack for the Consul because with the final action, Make Mischief, the Krampus can force the Heroes to attack each other if they have been turned into Naughties!

The Krampus's Boss Fight card help's ensure that at least one Hero will always suffer the fate of being transformed into a Naughtie thanks to Caught Red Handed. This ability also provides a fun interaction with Kringle's own Nice List ability. Run Free, Children turns the Heroes upon themselves, allowing the Consul to use Naughties to attack the party.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Bank of America Toy Bank Edition
boardgame.description:
Monopoly game with different tokens, properties, money design, etc. Each property is a picture of a rare, collectible "Penny Bank" from Bank of America's art collection. (From the back of the box.)

Contents:
Bank of America Custom Bank Money
ATMS and Banking Centers replace Traditional Houses and Hotels
Piggy Bank, Vault, Money Bag, Armored Car, BofA building, BofA logo tokens
Custom title deed cards feature case iron toy banks from Bank of America art collection
Custom cards replace classic Community Chest and Chance Cards

boardgame.name: Make Your Case
boardgame.description:
Make Your Case is an easy-to-learn, intuitive game that people can learn just after one round. One person (the judge) picks up a prompt card and the other players (lawyers) finish off the sentence with one of their cards and must explain why their card fits the prompt the best. Each lawyer has 30 seconds to make their case uninterrupted. Then they have another 15 seconds to either strengthen their case or attack the other lawyers' points.

At the end of the round, the judge decides which argument is the best and awards the point to that lawyer. The judgeship passes to the next person and the next round begins.

The person with the most points at the end of the game, wins.

boardgame.name: ArchiveOS Console Edition
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb
ArchiveOS is a journaling game about archiving video games using the postal service and Discord tags. Players use the zip code or number attached to a Discord handle to generate new retro video games, and then send the game to someone they know. The code used to generate the games will determine the game’s genre, theme, platform, features, and objects that come with the game, also known as feelies. Archivists will also use the page to design box art for the game in the space provided.

boardgame.name: ArchiveOS Computer Edition
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb
ArchiveOS is a journaling game about archiving video games using the postal service and Discord tags. Players use the zip code or number attached to a Discord handle to generate new retro video games, and then send the game to someone they know. The code used to generate the games will determine the game’s genre, theme, platform, features, and objects that come with the game, also known as feelies. Archivists will also use the page to design box art for the game in the space provided.

boardgame.name: Chat Chains
boardgame.description:
Goal:
Players earn points for building Chat Chains using Response Cards, working together to get the highest possible team score by having a focused conversation.

2-player: The first player (Chat Starter) selects a question from a Topic card to begin the chain, places this card in the center of the play area, and answers it for one point, or asks the next player to answer but earns no point. The next player continues the chain by answering, and placing a Response card next to the Topic card; if they need help in answering, they can get a suggestion from a Prompt card, but will not earn points for its placement in the chain. With 3+ players, Response cards can be kept in front of each player to track individual scoring.

Play continues with each player placing 1-2 Response cards. A conversation can include a combination of any types of questions, answers, or comments.

Round End:
A round ends when the Chat Chain is broken. This happens when:
-A player decides to finish the topic;
-A player goes off topic; or
-A player takes too long to respond.

3+ players:
More players introduce the optional gameplay role of Judge, a neutral observer who does not place cards.

Ending the Game:
The game can end after:
-10 rounds;
-30 minutes of gameplay; or
-A total team score of 200 is reached

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: 2021 Formula One
F1 2021
boardgame.description: The game will introduce a story mode called Braking Point, which features the returning fictional driver Devon Butler.

boardgame.name: Last Stop
boardgame.description: Set in present day London, the game centers on three characters, John, Donna and Meena, whose worlds collide in the midst of a supernatural crisis. An anthology drama, Last Stop is three stories in one.

boardgame.name: Neo: The World Ends with You
boardgame.description: Players can control multiple characters at once during combat and attack opponents with "psych" abilities granted by items called "pins".

boardgame.name: Fuga: Melodies of Steel
boardgame.description: The game takes place in a war-torn world populated by anthropomorphic dogs and cats, where a group of children struggle for survival aboard a giant tank against soldiers from an enemy nation.

boardgame.name: ENDER LILIES: Quietus of the Knights
boardgame.description: On this sorrowful journey, encounter horrific enemies against whom a moment of inattention could be fatal.

boardgame.name: Trollstone Caverns: Lair of the Silver Serpent
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

A GM Adventure for dT&T and Tunnels & Trolls

Your adventure begins on a small path that branches from the Great Khazan Road and leads at a cave mouth in the mountainside. Inside is the fabled Trollstone Caverns, home lair of the legendary Silver Serpent, and also for a large clan of Uruks—the Scarlet Wolf Clan To these caverns you have come in search of adventure, loot, or possibly even the venom of the Silver Serpent, a very valuable item among the mages in Khazan, certainly worth the effort - if you can survive!

This adventure is meant for 1st level and other beginning characters, It is meant for parties consisting of the good kindreds only; namely humans, dwarves, elves, leprechauns, fairies, and hobbs. It is possible that uruks might join such a party, but do not allow any other monster kindreds in.

boardgame.name: Villainous F***s
Villainous Fucks
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb
Villainous Fucks is a tabletop roleplaying game designed for 2-6 players, about doing petty crimes as The League of Villainous Fucks, and ruining the day of Superheroes and Cops alike (and truly what's the difference). Villainous Fucks runs on Spencer Campbells incredible LUMEN System, and is inspired by the best Villains across media. LUMEN is designed for quick, tactical combat, and Villainous Fucks dials it up to 11 for the best in zany comic book style action.

The game includes a flexible Villain maker, with a variety of available abilities, and I'm working currently on chocking it full of old public domain comic art (which takes a while to clean up), but is otherwise good to go pending some minor editing!

Villainous Fucks is rules-lite by design, with a focus on brewing your own powers, weapons, and enemies using the provided chassis! If this isn't your speed, there are some planned expansions for the game already that will contain more abilities, weapon tags, Henches, and lore!

boardgame.name: URGNCY V72
boardgame.description:
In this beat-the-clock cooperative space game! All of earth’s resources have been depleted! As a result, you & your team are on the last manned space mission to reach Planet V72, a planet that can sustain life & save the human race!

On your journey to saving all mankind, everything that can go wrong does go wrong! As a team, fix each situation that arises with your problem-prone ship as fast as you can before time expires in each of the games four timed rounds, in order to advance to the next round! If time runs out in any of the four rounds your team will perish & all mankind will cease to exist!

Get through all four rounds & make it to Planet V72 & into the history books as the team who saved the human race!

boardgame.name: Hangadó
The Sound Maker
What's That Sound?
繪聲繪影
boardgame.description:
Of course you recognise that sound, but what’s making it?

Work out the possible origins of different sounds made by players as quickly as you can to win as many points as you can!

In short:

Guess the cards by making the best sound effects
Work out the images that go with the sound effects of other players
Be the fastest to win the most points!


—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Title: The Sound Maker Publisher: Blue Orange Language(s): English German French Dutch Spanish Italian Portugese

boardgame.name: Karten Kniffel
boardgame.description:
Card Yatzy is not played with dice but with 52 cards (values 1 to 6, 2 times each in 4 suits and 4 jokers).

Each player receives 6 cards and places one of them face down in front of him. The player whose turn it is can either draw a card from the deck face down and lay a hand card face up or draw a card face up and lay it face up. In the 2nd case, a hand card and a card from the deck must also be placed face up.

A round continues until each player has 5 cards in front of him. When evaluating the combinations achieved (different point values), only the highest combination of each type is scored. For example, if there are two doubles of 4, only the highest one counts and the other player can only score a double of 3.

After nine rounds the game ends, the player with the highest score from the combinations wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: SHASN: AZADI
boardgame.description:
SHASN: AZADI is a semi-cooperative political strategy board game where players play as revolutionaries, trying to free their country from the grips of a tyrannical imperial power. If they succeed, only one will emerge as the leader of the new nation.

Each player must work with their compatriots to topple the Imperials and gain freedom for their nation. But every time a player takes a turn, the Crown will march forward and the Imperials will take a turn, launching devastating attacks against the revolution.

Players can combat the Imperials by resolving Azadi Cards. From Jallianwala Bagh to the battle of Yorktown, each Azadi Card is a unique event from history.

Each Azadi Card has two sides, presenting players with two divergent paths of resistance. Will players take the path of peace and sit on a hunger strike, or will they take up arms and assassinate their oppressors? Each choice in an Azadi Card belongs to a certain Ideologue. Players must choose their path wisely, for their choice will unlock a new zone, and a Resistance Card belonging to that Ideologue, strengthening that Ideologue for the rest of the game.

For every action you complete on an AZADI Card, you will gain legacy. Spend your legacy to erect Monuments to your sacrifice and earn new powers once your nation gains Azadi. If players resolve the number of Azadi Cards required by their difficulty, and a final Foundation Card before time runs out - Azadi will be theirs.

But the new sovereign nation will need a leader. Players must compete in the first democratic elections of their country to see who will be declared winner.

What will you stand for? And what will freedom cost?

boardgame.name: Kirakós
boardgame.description:
The year is early 2005 in Northern-Europe. A series of murders have been committed in three countries in parallel, and all signs point to a connection with something that happened twenty years before. Will you (and your co-players) be able to figure out the riddles you find along the way or will you need help from the game characters? And most importantly: will you find out the motive before the story ends?
Kirakós is a crime novel combined with a game – a detective story where you are the hero. It is up to you to solve the riddles in time and make the correct deductions about the crime, before the inbuilt characters beat you to it.
•••
A Kirakós nem szokványos krimi. A méltán népszerű skandináv bűnügyi regények műfaját ötvözi az otthon játszható szabadulószoba-könyvek feltörekvő trendjével.
Tökéletesen élvezhető a „hagyományos” módon, az olvasó sorról sorra halad, közben találgat és gondolkozik a történetet illetően, amely végül teljes egészében kibontakozik előtte.
Lehetőség nyílik azonban időről időre a nyomozók bőrébe bújni, a könyvben tíz egyértelműen jelzett feladvány található, amelyek megoldásához semmi más nem szükséges, mint az eltérő betűtípussal szedett szöveg és az Ön leleményessége. Ezeknél a pontoknál kicsit megáll az idő, és mindenki kedvére kutakodhat a könyvön kívüli világban, később pedig ellenőrizheti, helyes megoldásra jutott-e.
—Hungarian part is description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Whitetail Wilderness: Woodland Pursuit – Hunter Skills Expansion
boardgame.description:
This 18-card expansion for Whitetail Wilderness: Woodland Pursuit adds more options for players to include when constructing their player deck at the beginning of the game.

The cards in this expansion bring new skills and card abilities to the hunter's repertoire. They include Resilience (reclaim a card from the discard pile), Regroup (draw three cards), Scout (flip locations when adjacent), and Stalk (move and then Hunt).

There are also new variations of Hunt and Wild cards to provide even more variety and further options when building your deck.

boardgame.name: Quak Quak
boardgame.description:
The front cover explains the whole game. Each player receives four frogs, which he jumps into the well. Whoever manages to do this first is the winner.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Fistful of Lead: Horse & Musket – 2nd Edition
boardgame.description:
These rules are designed to fight skirmishes during the black powder era.

This rulebook is extremely versatile because it easily covers many conflicts of the 18th and early 19th century; from Napoleonics to the War of Spanish Succession, and covers the wars in America: French Indian War, American War of Independence, War of 1812 and the American Civil War.

This 2nd edition brings the Horse & Musket genre into line with our Core System. It is a stand-alone game.

What else is included in the 2nd edition of Horse & Musket rules?

Full Color, 52 pages
Perfect Bound Cover
4 Exclusive New Scenarios


P.S. The Horse & Musket Custom Cards have NOT CHANGED.

–description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: War of the Spanish Succession

boardgame.name: Forgotten Temple of the Frogfolk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forgotten temple of the Frogfolk is a short adventure for an adventuring party of four characters with an average party level (APL) of 4. Characters will unravel a magical murder mystery surrounding the release of a magical energy drink and journey deep into a primeval swamp to battle a long-sealed fragment of an unfathomable creature never meant to inhabit the mortal realm. This adventure is campaign agnostic and can be inserted into any campaign that contains a giant, wooded wetland.

This adventure should take 1-2 sessions to complete.

boardgame.name: Knights of the Round Cheese
boardgame.description:
Knights of the Round Cheese is a two-player game in the universe of Fox Matters. While Fox King and his Fox Knights are fighting Nightmares, the citizens of Foxenfurt decide to form their own hero parties. Each player uses Cards in hand to recruit Foxes from a common Track to their personal Party. The Party that scored more points wins.
Knights of the Round Cheese is a minimalist competitive card-drafting game. An enjoyable, yet deep 2-player battle of wits condensed to 27 cards and 15 minutes. You can buy two copies to play up to 3-4 players.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bloodlines & Black Magic Core Rulebook
Bloodlines & Black Magic: A Dark, Modern Roleplaying Game
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bloodlines & Black Magic is a dark, supernatural-themed roleplaying game set in a world that mirrors the one we think we know...

Built in the same world in which we originally released our Pathfinder edition of the game (found here), this edition of the game updates the world while giving gamers a 5e-compatible version of the rules. This edition of the book is much larger than the original was, totaling 472 pages compared to the previous book's 256 pages. In fact, this edition of the book expands a lot of the world, offering readers two chapters (10, 11) filled with lore about the world that game masters can use to help create vivid, supernatural stories set in the darker corners of our modern world.

In development since 2018, this edition of Bloodlines & Black Magic gives players and game masters so much more to work with, including over 100 pages of spells designed exclusively for modern play. Similar in many ways to their 5e counterparts, these spells are described in the context of this modern world, with each spell providing game masters with a brief description of how onlookers might perceive the magic. Likewise, this edition explains and expands attunement. Heroes in Bloodlines & Black Magic can attune to more than just magical weapons; heroes can attune to magical places, otherworldly entities (via pacts and familiars), trusted allies, skills, their bloodline abilities, and the special items they find throughout the Invisible World.

In addition to updating each of the bloodlines and all seven classes from the original game, this edition of the book gives players and game masters a chapter filled with backgrounds, as well as additional options to enhance or deepen your hero's story. Players will find pages of additional options that let them expand their character's history, their resources, and help them deepen their stories.

Blending the visual approach of a black & white project, this edition of the book bends some of the colors back into the Invisible World, giving readers updates to the art throughout the book. While the content in this book mirrors much of what is found in the black & white edition, this version includes updates and errata.

Bloodlines & Black Magic is a horror roleplaying game that addresses the monsters lurking in the supernatural realms, as well as the
broken people in our world. As such, it deals with mature concepts and ideas. While we take care to remind you throughout the book,
you should be aware of this before you open the cover.

Warning: If you are sensitive to horror, the occult, or supernatural themes, please consider playing a different game.

This game engages in nuanced discussions about violence (and how to avoid it), monsters, cryptids, horror, death, necromancy, Goëtic Spirits, magic, psychic abilities, portals to other worlds, conspiracy theories, and secret governments, as well as a host of other strange topics best suited for uncovering mysteries and delving deeper into the Invisible World.
boardgame.rpg: Bloodlines & Black Magic: A Dark, Modern Roleplaying Game

boardgame.name: Thane Gorr's Vault
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An original level 2-4 adventure made for D&D 5e.

A race for treasure! The heroes obtain a map to the resting place of Thane Gorr, a legendary dwarf lord, but they’re not the only ones with a copy of the map. Several factions seek to unlock the secrets of the thane’s vault and face the tomb’s ghastly defenders.

boardgame.name: Pathfinder Battles: Iconic Heroes Evolved
boardgame.description:
Pathfinder Battles: Iconic Heroes Evolved includes six all-new miniatures featuring all new sculpts in a dynamic pose of legendary characters from the Pathfinder role-playing universe

Characters featured in this set list include:


Valeros, human fighter
Harsk, dwarf ranger
Seoni, human sorcerer
Fumbus, goblin alchemist
Merisiel, elf rogue
Kyra, human cleric
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game (Paizo Publishing)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Core Set
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Mummy's Mask – Base Set
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Skull & Shackles – Base Set
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous – Base Set

boardgame.name: Beneath the Reeds (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beneath the Reeds is an encounter stemming from a necromantic circle’s energies being renewed as a result of a fae ‘burial harmony’ taking place in the surrounding waters. Death may be inevitable, but undeath is only an unfortunate step away for the unprepared.

Beneath the Reeds is a Q-Encounter, or Quick-Encounter, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 7th-level characters, ranging from medium to hard in difficulty.

boardgame.name: Patrol Ship Names
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Braving the vast emptiness of a solar system, looking for ships in need of help from pirates or more mundane issues, patrol ships keep order and security. Never be without a name for these stalwarts of order. Download d66 Patrol Ship Names now.
11 Antares Strongarm
31 Gargoyle
54 Rose Star

boardgame.name: Tanker Ship Names
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Why spend a day holding position inside a gas giant while waiting for fuel to slowly process when you have deliveries to make? Dock with a tanker ship and quickly refuel and get back on schedule. Never be without a name for these orbital fuel ships. Download d66 Tanker Ship Names now.
12 Carlsbad
26 Evenstar Titan
51 Orion's Pride

boardgame.name: Mort à Sacinay
boardgame.description:
Murder Party without any game master required.
You and your friends must find out who killed the architect Pierre Detayes. But the killer is one of you!

5 suspects, 1 culprit and 1 or 2 investigators will play their role for a few hours, after the reading of the victim's will.
Clues are made available as the game progresses, and the detective(s) will be able to conduct individual interrogations while the other players will try to glean information on their own by discussing, observing, and making alliances.

Players are provided with a character sheet, given to them before the game starts, so that they can get used to the role. During the game, the culprit tries to cover his tracks, while the other players try to determine his identity. They must also complete a secret mission before the end of the game.

boardgame.name: Relics of Rajavihara: Thrill Seeker Expansion Pack
boardgame.description: 20 Additional levels to challenge your brain! Master these puzzling levels and collect lots of gems along the way.

boardgame.name: La Vendée 1793: Counter-revolution in the West
boardgame.description: This area movement game depicts the first Royalist rising in 1793, centering on the “White” player’s attempt to capture and hold Republican fortresses. If all goes well the English may enter the fray. Meanwhile “Blue” Republican armies attempt to overwhelm their weaker foe and implement a scorched-earth policy while partisans harry their every move. Event cards present both sides with opportunities and challenges.

listing.notes: Boxed edition. Brand new in shrink wrap Authorized dealer of Against The Odds Products I am the owner of A Gray Rooster Sales LLC Ships same day as payment received from New Philadelphia, Ohio. PayPal Only. Sales Tax For Ohio Residents PM or email with any questions. sales@agrsales.com

boardgame.name: Immortal Arms
boardgame.description:
With the basic game style, it's 1-on-1. You versus your opponent. Each player randomly draws a character and a weapon. These cards have 3 different traits (Speed, Power, and Finesse). These traits correspond to the dice you will use when battling, so a 4 is a d4, a 6 is a d6, and so forth. When you fight, you roll 1d4 to determine which attack you will use against your enemy.

1 = Speed (Red). 2 = Power (White). 3 = Finesse (Grey). 4 = You choose the attack, or Roll to select again with a Bonus (Green)

Since your weapon and character both have traits, you will actually be rolling 2 dice per attack. If a 1 was rolled on your 1d4 for attack selection for the round, you would use Speed as your attack. Your opponent might have a different trait they are using against you, since they also roll 1d4 to determine which type of attack they will use. You might have 1d4 for your character's Speed, but 1d8 for your weapon's speed. You roll these 2 dice together, add them together, and compare to your opponent's total from their 2 dice. Damage is dealt in the difference between the two sums.

Strategy comes from things like:

Blocks - double your dice total but you can't damage your opponent. Typically you get 1 block per match, so use it wisely!
Max Dice Damage - even if you're rolling 2D4 vs. an opponent's 1D8 and 1D10, you can still deal damage to them if you max out either or both of your dice! Whenever a character rolls the highest number possible on any die, they deal an automatic point of damage to their opponent. In this way, there is a chance to deal damage to an opponent even if you don't win the round.
Weapon Bonuses - Most characters have 2-3 weapons they have +1 to dice rolls on if they have a matching weapon.
Choice Bonuses - Each character can also get a bonus to attack rolls if they give up their choice when they roll a d4 and get a 4 for attack selection. If so, they roll again and have to take whatever they get, but they attack with a bonus on their rolls.
Alternate Rules Cards - Putting one of these into play at the beginning of a match can totally change the game mechanics. With 36 different variations, it can really put a new spin on things! These are my favorite part of the game.
Special Characters - 9 of the 27 characters have no weapon bonuses, but instead have special powers or abilities.
3-on-3 Elimination Matches - Continue fighting with your characters until they are reduced to 0 Hit Points, pulling a new character into the match until either you or your opponents have lost 3 characters.
3-5 Player Battle Royale Matches - Alternate rules for playing with more than 1 opponent. Last one standing wins!
With all of these options, this becomes a great game for 2-5 players, whether you only have 10 minutes to play or an hour. All it takes is 1 set of 90 cards, some standard RPG dice (D4/D6/D8/D10/D12/D20), and a friend!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Froggy Bazaar
boardgame.description:
Froggy merchants expand the floating market in this variable worker placement game. Catch flies, claim lily-pads, build hat stands, hat shops, and haberdasheries, and trade goods at the driftwood market.

In Froggy Bazaar players play the part of a froggy merchant. They take turns moving around the floating market. They claim lily-pads and construct various shops. As the market expands, player options increase.

The game board consists a central driftwood market tile, surrounded by 8 lily-pad tiles. In each turn players 1) move their frog, 2) take either one or both actions on the tile that they moved onto. This can be a range of actions from building a shop on a lily-pad tile, to collecting resources from shops, or upgrading shops.

Throughout the game players collect river rocks which they place in a felt bag. As players achieve objectives (build or upgrade shops, collect hats, visit every tile) they achieve objectives (and collect more river rocks). The game ends when a player achieves their fourth objective. The player with the most river rocks wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Reinforcements
boardgame.description:
Build your army. Crush your friends.

REINFORCEMENTS combines fun and simplicity with elements of strategy and planning. Build up your army to unlock more actions and summon the mythical totems that embody the kingdoms of the realm. Barrage your foes, Fortify your army, or Adapt to the situation at hand. Every move matters as you try to be the last Kingdom standing. Do you have what it takes? Inspired by the classic card game War.

In the game you will be starting with a handful of five cards and three face-down Foundations (selected during setup). On your turn, you can do one of three things: use a card in your hand to Attack the lead card in one of your opponents "stacks", Defend your foundations by adding a card that matches the suit of that foundation from your hand to the "stack", or Discard as many cards from your hand as you want (you will fill back up to begin your next turn.)

Once you add a third card to a stack, that stack is turned face up and you draw a card from the top of the draw pile to start a new foundation. Having a faceup stack will give you a bonus depending on the suit. A faceup stack of Blue cards allows you to Fortify which lets you take an additional Defend action on your turn if you have a blue card in hand that you can place. A faceup stack of Red cards allows you to Barrage your opponent by allowing you and additional attack on your opponent each turn if you have a red card in hand. Finally, a faceup Green stack gives you the ability to Adapt by either swapping a green card from your hand with a green card from the stack or swapping the position of two of the green cards in your faceup stack.

Each color of stack that is face up grants you these abilities, so they can add up quickly and each color that's face up also gives you a passive ability: blue - your blue stacks may now have 4 cards instead of just 3, red - red cards that attack or Barrage automatically win all ties, green - your hand size increases by 1 for every faceup green stack in your army. Cards range in value from 1-7 and it's a basic war mechanic that higher card beats lower card, however if you win a battle (i.e. your six beats your opponents' two) any extra points carry on to the next card in the line (in the example you would have four points left to face whatever card was next in line.)

If there is a tie both players yell “REINFORCEMENTS!!!” Each player MUST yell this when a tie occurs. This rule is non negotiable. Players draw the top card off of the draw pile and flip them until the battle is resolved. There are also some special cards that truly mess things up (Assassins, Mages, and mobs of Peasants) and if you flip two stacks of one color or one stack of each color (three stacks in total) one of the Totems will visit you and provide a special power. But you have to use it before an opponent completes their requirement and steals the Totem from you.

boardgame.name: Burgundia: Campaign Setting
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pathfinder Second Edition Campaign Setting

As a member of Nachtrichter you operate on the fringes of society, enforcing the Accords of the Great War. You and your fellow agents defend a peaceful civilization against the forces that would see mankind’s fate devolve. 1930’s Europa, a time of sorcery and intrigue. Zeppelins soar above while dark plots, secret societies, and the saber rattling from old rivalries threaten the fragile peace. A place where evil walks the cobblestones of Paris and Prague. The world is not solely the province of mankind. An ancient dimensional rift proved that we are not alone. The barrier between worlds that has protected humanity has proven porous and permeable.Enter a world of fantasy noir, where a you fight against corrupt and powerful forces, in a reality where fate can hang on a roll of the dice.

boardgame.name: Faceted: A Steven Universe RPG
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a fan of the hit cartoon Steven Universe? Have you ever wanted to play out stories set in this world with your friends? Do you like free pen and paper role playing games? Then Faceted is for you!

Faceted is a pen and paper game set in the Steven Universe world, using the extremely adaptable Powered by the Apocalypse engine to allow you to create characters quickly and jump right into playing out your stories.

Faceted includes the following:


Rules for making your own gemsona, either a full gem or a half-human hybrid.
Ten unique roles: seven basic roles for players just looking to jump right in and three advanced roles for players who want a little more crunch for their gemsona.
A whole host of moves to fill out your gemsona and make them truly unique.
Detailed instructions on making set pieces and antagonists for your characters to befriend, overcome, or ignore completely!
Three short campaign starters for those who know they want to play the game but aren't sure what kind of campaign they want.
Now updated with more Human Moves, giving you more options to use Sync and Facet!

boardgame.name: Eksplodujące Minionki
Exploding Minions
Robbanó minyonok
มินเนี่ยนระเบิด
boardgame.description:
Introducing: Exploding Minions! Play the all new Minions themed version of your favorite explosive card game featuring new card types and magical bananas.

Exploding Minions is a Minions-powered version of Russian Roulette. Players take turns drawing cards until someone draws an Exploding Minion and loses the game. The deck is made up of cards that let you avoid exploding by peeking at cards before you draw, forcing your opponent to draw multiple cards, or shuffling the deck.

The game gets more and more intense with each card you draw because fewer cards left in the deck means a greater chance of drawing the Exploding Minion.

The Minions bring a new game-changing card with them that allows players to Clone cards.

boardgame.name: Diuna: Planeta Intryg i Konfliktów
Duna: Um Jogo de Conquistas e Diplomacia
Dune: A Game of Conquest and Diplomacy
Dűne: A hódítás és diplomácia játéka
Dune: Ein Spiel um Macht und Intrigen
Dune: Un Gioco di Conquista e Diplomazia
Dune: Un jeu de Conquête et de Diplomatie
Dune: Un juego de Conquista y Diplomacia
Дюна. Завоевание и дипломатия
boardgame.description:
Take part in one of the most famous science-fiction stories of all time. Dune: A Game of Conquest and Diplomacy builds on 40 years of development, refinement, and evolution from the original classic game. It has the same beloved DNA, flavor, tension, and themes, but with new game-board design, more spice, new streamlined rules, and a new market deck from which you can purchase game advantages. Also, the brand new two-player mode really opens up new gaming opportunities, all making the game more accessible for even the most casual gamer.

In Dune, you will take control of one of the four great factions—House Atreides, House Harkonnen, the Fremen, and the Imperium—all vying to control the most valuable resource in the universe: melange, the mysterious spice only found at great cost on the planet Dune. Ship your forces to Dune, harvest spice, seize control of strongholds, and destroy your enemies. Who will control Dune? You decide!

The game is played multiple phases, some of which don't have player specific actions, like in the Spice phase, a Spice Blow card is drawn and spice is added to the board in two territories, or else a Sandworm attacks that last two territories where spice was placed. But on the card phase, each player draws up to a hand of 4 Battle cards, and then may purchase Market cards up to a hand of 3 for 2 spice each. On the Shipping and Movement Phase, players take turns adding forces to the board and then moving forces on the board. Each player's faction has

The game plays 3 to 5 Rounds. Starting on Round 3, the game can end if a player occupies 3 strongholds at the end of the Round. If no one occupies 3 strongholds at the end of Round 5, then the player with the most spice wins (and each stronghold they occupy counts as 5 spice).

boardgame.name: The Plum Island Horror
boardgame.description:
The Plum Island Horror is a 1 to 4 player game featuring cooperative play that combines tactical-level unit management with a tower-defense style survival mechanic. Each player will control one of six unique factions which represent the various groups that populate Plum Island. Each of these Factions has its own strengths and weaknesses, and the system encourages you to optimize for the group’s strengths and marginalize its weaknesses. Players must coordinate with one another, and the resulting synergy will hopefully be enough to successfully evacuate a city under siege and contain the horrific outbreak that threatens to spread beyond the island itself. If the players can succeed, they will win together, and the world will most likely be none the wiser to the averted crisis. If not, they will lose together and share the blame equally for failing humankind.

—description from the publisher
