boardgame.name: HEX4
boardgame.description:
HEX4 is a simple, yet challenging strategy board game for 2-4 players.

HEX4 - The Standard Edition (2 players)

Each player has 15 of their own colored player pieces, and play on a hexagon grid board.

Players take turns playing their pieces to the grid, attempting to lay 4 of their colored pieces in a row. The game starts off as simple as tic-tac-toe, but once each player has at least 2 of their own colored pieces in the grid, on any future turns they may move an already played piece to CAP their opponent, if they choose. This is where the game becomes dynamic and interesting. Players will continue back and forth - playing new pieces, moving pieces, and capping their opponent - until one player lays 4 of their colored pieces in a row!

HEX4 - The Deluxe Edition (2 to 4 players)

The Deluxe Edition comes with 60 player pieces (15 of 4 different colors)

A standard game of HEX4 last anywhere between 2-5 minutes.

We recommend players ages 10+ (although players as young as 4 have beat their grandparents)

boardgame.name: Great Western Trail (Drugie wydanie)
Great Western Trail (Second Edition)
Great Western Trail (Seconda Edizione)
大西部開拓者
boardgame.description:
America in the 19th century: You are a rancher and repeatedly herd your cattle from Texas to Kansas City, where you send them off by train. This earns you money and victory points. Needless to say, each time you arrive in Kansas City, you want to have your most valuable cattle in tow. However, the "Great Western Trail" not only requires that you keep your herd in good shape, but also that you wisely use the various buildings along the trail. Also, it might be a good idea to hire capable staff: cowboys to improve your herd, craftsmen to build your very own buildings, or engineers for the important railroad line.

If you cleverly manage your herd and navigate the opportunities and pitfalls of Great Western Trail, you surely will gain the most victory points and win the game.

The second edition of Great Western Trail includes solitaire rules, making for a player count of 1-4.

Second Edition:
Remember the old days in the West? Well, the times they are a-changing’! From new solo opponent to incredible landscapes, you won't know where to start. And there is a new herd of cows for you to sell!

Great Western Trail is the critically acclaimed game of cattle ranching by Alexander Pfister. Players attempt to wrangle their herd across the Midwest prairie and deliver it to Kansas City. But beware! Other cowboys are sharing the trail with you. We invite you to saddle up!

The changes in the Second edition:


Brand New Artwork by Chris Quilliams
Solo Mode: A New Challenger in the West
Dual-Layered Player Boards
Addition of a new breed of cows: The Simmental breed
Two new reversible buildings (#11 & 12)
Twelve Exchange Tokens, First introduced in the Rails of North Expansion, for more interaction with other players
Four new Master Tiles added for more strategy, replayability, and challenges


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Power Station
boardgame.description:
From the description (translated from French):

In the middle of the vast meadows is a place sought after by many brave mice. This place is the powerhouse. A loaner car battery and its jumper cables have been retooled and used to recharge and power the weapons of the brave explorers. But this power is a gamble, the powerhouse is known to strike back in shocking ways. Seek power at your own risk, and use the charge wisely.

boardgame.name: The Ten Commandments
boardgame.description: A 5th edition supplement featuring the 10 Commandments as D&D monsters, 10 additional monsters, 2 celestial themed subclasses, and new magic items, spells, and feats.

boardgame.name: Corrupted Faith
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Corrupted Faith is an adventure designed for 3-6 Level 9 characters for use with the 5th Edition ruleset.

boardgame.name: Russia Besieged: Deluxe Edition – Finnish Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Finnish Expansion is an extensive package expands and complements Russia Besieged Deluxe Edition (ownership of this game is required), the finest Corps/Army level treatments of the fighting on the Eastern Front in World War II.

This expansion completes the entire Eastern Front experience by adding a map that covers Finland from Helsinki, Leningrad, Archangel, Petsamo and Murmansk. As an added bonus, included in this package is an historical Battle of Kursk scenario.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Medieval Genius
boardgame.description:
Overview
Explore a game of Science, Technology, & Engineering in a world of Mushrooms, Monsters, & Magik. It is always your turn in this 4X, War-Mongering, Empire-Building, Real-Time-Strategy Board Game. There are 4 ways to win:
1st - Collect 6 Matching STEM Points
2nd - Muster 6 Mushroom Forests
3rd - Control 8 Trolls On the Map
4th - Get All Of The Battle Tokens By Taking Home Bases

The Game "Optimized For MAXIMUM Fun!"
Finally, a game with minimal waiting, where players take their turns simultaneously together "First-Come First-Serve." Choose from a range of characters (minorities/women in STEM)! Explore a new map every game! Harness magik from Mushrooms around the world to make your character magical, or make investments that allow you to build a mighty empire or conduct research to refine your STEM skills, or recruit armies to defend yourself against both humans & monsters!

The Scenario
Based on the book, "The Art of Good Magik," The Black Sorcerer’s quest for omniscience threatens destruction of all life in an Enchanted Land of Medieval Fantasy & Magical Mystery. Scientists & Engineers from Modern Earth awaken in this hallucination, and here you are, walking in their footsteps! Will you survive? Define how Magik, Military-Strategy, & STEM might aid you in your rise to greatness!

boardgame.name: Zeichen und Wunder
boardgame.description:
The game combines several tasks known from other games and places them in a religious-Christian context. The players solve tasks such as "draw or pantomime a term", "explain a term without taboo words", "fill in a blank", "name Christian terms with given initial letters". Whoever solves the task correctly moves his figure towards the goal. The players who correctly guess the terms are also rewarded. The winner is the one who reaches the goal first.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Bubble Stories
Detektyw Bombel
boardgame.description:
Step into the world of Bubble Stories with two adventures where you are the hero!

Discover new worlds by exploring, card after card, all the places you can visit! Enjoy each place along the way and discover what is hidden at the end of each adventure!


Choose the different places you wish to explore.
Turn each card over one after another.
Successfully reach your goal !


For example, in the first scenario you are looking for your friends into your school during a game of hide and seek. Places just like classroom, playground, gymnasium have to be explored! Return the the corresponding cards and find your friends.

In short, Bubble Stories is my first solo narrative card game without text.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 99 Gemeinheiten
99 Gemeinheiten: Im Betrieb
99 Gemeinheiten: Im Strassenverkehr
99 Gemeinheiten: Unter Freunden
boardgame.description:
The playing cards show different aggressive (mostly also punishable) actions with which one can annoy his fellow men (in the enterprise the bosses and colleagues). Two of these actions match each other and these cards are to be laid out by the players as a pair. The player who got rid of his hand cards ends the game. The winner is the player who has collected the most pairs.

There are four different theme sets, each with the same game principle:

In marriage
In traffic
In business
Among friends


—user summary

boardgame.name: Milky Way Prince - The Vampire Star
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Live a summer in a dysfunctional, abusive relationship in this branching story line visual novel by Lorenzo Radaell and Eyeguys.


A visual novel about an abusive relationship, idealization, and intimacy.

Live a summer of dysfunctional love through branching storylines, twists, sudden changes, and a special mechanic where you choose which senses to use with your boyfriend. In these moments, you will learn about him, his personality, and his past, making you question everything.

Milky Way Prince is a semi-autobiographical story entirely designed, programmed, illustrated, and scored by a young author, Lorenzo Redaelli.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Fistful of Nothing
boardgame.description:
You are stuck in a building with no exit, Surrounded by armed gunmen and elevators that choose to not work properly. Use an empty gun and your wits to trick your way to safety to LIVE to see another day!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Fußball-WM Würfelspiel
boardgame.description:
Each player has a goalkeeper and 10 field players with whom he can move across the field. The ball itself is also represented as a game piece. The dice are rolled for the ball and the players. The player with the ball first moves the ball (horizontally, vertically or diagonally) to an unoccupied field, and then 3 of his field players, also horizontally, vertically or diagonally. The opposing player also moves 3 field players with the same number of dice. If a field player of the player previously in possession of the ball is standing by the ball after the movement, he remains in possession of the ball. If only one field player of the opponent is standing by the ball, the opponent gains possession of the ball. There are additional rules for the goalkeeper, fouls, offsides, offsides and penalty kicks. The player who has scored the most goals after an agreed period of time wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Årets Chef
boardgame.description:
Meteors, zombies, strikes in the coffee industry, and African killer bees. Your company has had it's shares of wild scenarios. But how is the boss going to solve the problems? By having a crisis meeting? Or how about a pet pig for the employees? That should fix everything.

In "ÅRETS CHEF" ("Boss of the Year") players take turns being the boss of a fictional company, which is facing a series of wacky challenges. The boss has to – with the help of the employees – find the best solution.

In the game the boss can be one of four types, which all makes decisions based on the characteristics of the given type. The boss can be the good boss, the bad boss, the nutty boss, and the burned-out boss. All four boss types are created as archetypes and are meant to spark some fun discussions and good laughs.

The game is perfect for your company's next social event, or for a good evening with your friends.

The game is played over 8 rounds in which the players take turn being the boss.
In each round the player goes through the following phases:

· The boss is secretly dealt a boss type card.
· The boss draws a challenge card and reads it out loud.
· The employees play a solution card from their hand face down.
· Solution cards are shuffled and read out loud by the boss.
· The boss picks the solution that fits the boss type the best (the boss is always right in his/her choice).
· Players secretly guess what type the boss is.
· The boss reveals his/her boss type.

Player who guessed the correct boss type, score their solution card (worth 1 point).
If a least one player guessed the correct boss type, the boss scores the challenge card (worth 2 points).
The player who played the solution card the boss choose, becomes the boss in the next round.

After 8 round the players with the most points wins the game.

boardgame.name: The Drain
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Drain is a tense level-0 funnel adventure for the Mothership Sci-Fi Horror RPG set in a combat-ravaged farming habitat.

Each player runs 4-5 level-0 prisoner-soldiers through the hellish battlefield of the colony ship Within Wheels. Their mission: win freedom by acquiring a legendary religious relic at the behest of their corporate jailors, PrayCo.

The Wheel's hollow internal landscape of barren fields and rusting, bombed out structures swarm with monstrous bioengineered animals and lethal corporate relic hunters. Trenches, minefields, hull punctures and a stalemated battle bar passage from the high-gravity docking bays to the blasphemous prize waiting at the funnel's tip.

Simple farmers of the rotating colony ship Within Wheels starve as bargain InstaCrops wither on the vine. They turn to faith and ritual, concocting visions of a hell on earth from half-remembered traditions and commercialized lore. Bunker doors seal as their beacon calls upon believers to consecrate synthetic soil with holy blood.

The Drain takes a WWI influenced war-as-hell meat grinder and mashes it with bleak, occult survival horror themes drawn from video games like Silent Hill, Resident Evil, and Darkwood. This 16-page zine is packed with everything you need to churn out a crop of battle hardened level-1 characters from level-0 rabble, including:


Brand new rules for running carnage-filled funnels in Mothership.
A funnel crawl map by Andrew Walter, gorgeously illuminated to chart the party's movement through the conical space.
Vicious new items to arm your mob of funnel PCs.

boardgame.name: Das Kreuzwortspiel
boardgame.description:
The players try to score as many points as possible by laying out letters in a colored crossword grid. They are free to choose which of the available letters they want to use. It should be noted that only valid German words (lexicon) can be formed, and valuable letters should be placed on own color fields if possible (plus points). Letters on opposing fields cause minus points. As soon as the target field has been reached, the game ends and the player with the most accumulated points wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Brac's Guide to Piracy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Brac’s Guide to Piracy is the ultimate guide to running or playing in a campaign of blood and treasure! Hoist the colors and set sail on any of the more than a dozen new ships, from your standard sloops and galleons to the mighty orcish juggernaut to the squidships of the starspawn captains. Recruit a crew from over two dozen named pirate NPCs each with their own plot hooks, and sail into ship combat, or board the enemy vessel to seize cargo and get rich with astonishing speed!

Or come at the campaign from the opposite direction, playing as one of four new aquatic races which, in conjunction with the three already officially published - yes, three, Locathah Rising has playable locathah stats - allows for an entire party with swim speeds and underwater breathing right from level 1. Resist the onslaught of the Sahuagin Empire, explore shipwrecks and sunken temples, and make contact with the surface worlders in search of allies against the threats below.

Stalk the trade routes of the high seas, rolling on special pirate encounter tables that might turn up anything from a storm caused by angry water and air elementals to a cove of potentially friendly merfolk who may need your assistance against some undersea threat, a sunken ship laden with treasure that you might be able to recover if you’ve got the potions of water breathing for it to a rival pirate who you might team up with against a particularly big prize or just sink so as to have less competition, a fisher boat being attacked by a giant shark to a moving island on the back of a giant dragon turtle, and of course you might actually find the merchant shipping you came out here to plunder in the first place.

Discover unmarked islands, clear out any monster infestations they may be suffering from, and build up hidden coves where you can come for repair and resupply even when official ports are closed to you. As your secret network of ports expands, capture new ships and leave friendly pirate crewmates in charge of them to keep the ports safe, until your pirate fleet has grown strong enough to challenge the empire and break their oppressive reign over the waters.

‘Cause these waters don’t need any empires. We’ll be alright so long’s the wind is in our sails, and we’ll all hang on behind.

boardgame.name: Red Dawn
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Minions of an ancient and immortal vampire seek to release him and usher in an era of darkness. Engage in a race against time in an adventure that ranges from the arctic to the very sun itself. Suitable for Pathfinder for characters 9th to 12th.

“Do you know why you fear the dark? Do you know why the accursed star of day gives you comfort? Your ancestors knew why. The night once ruled the day, yes! What splendid nights those were! My master was Lord of the Night, who ruled over you mortal fools like your farmers rule over your cattle! The world was right, then, everything in its proper place. We hunted, and we fed, and we killed, and we paid tribute to our master, whose darkness outshone the sun! Most importantly, we kept you in line, my sheep.” - Duncan Redback, servant of the vampire king.

boardgame.name: How Many Stars?
boardgame.description:
In How Many Stars, players are 'Bidding' to get as close as possible to the answer to a question, such as "How many stars are in the Milky Way" or "What % of Brits like Simon Cowell", without going over.

Bid or Pass?

Players take it in turns to ‘bid’ on the answer, where the next bid must be a higher answer than the previous. If a player thinks that the answer has got too high, they can pass.

Reveal!

Once all players have passed except one, the answer is revealed. If the final player's answer is at, or below, the correct answer, they score points. If the answer is even just a fraction above, all the other players score points.

Confident?

Think you know the exact answer? Then slap your hand on the Star Card while shouting out the answer. If you're exactly correct, you score lots of points! If you're wrong, however, all the other players score lots of points! Risky.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Operation Theseus: Gazala 1942
boardgame.description:
Operation Theseus - Gazala 1942 is an operational level simulation of the Gazala battles of 1942, which took place during May and June 1942.

The game is intended for two players but is also suitable for solitaire and team play. The goal for the Axis player is to hit the Allied forces hard and to seize specific victory locations, thereby opening the door to Egypt. The Allied player wants to prevent this from happening, thereby eliminating the Axis potential for further offensives.

The game is played in a semi-interactive way and makes both players sit on the fence at all time.

It uses the same core system as VUCA's earlier Crossing the Line.
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Triumphant Fox: Rommel's Finest Hour – The Gazala Battles May-June 1942

boardgame.name: Into the Wyrd and Wild (Revised)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beyond the reach of roads, past the scope of mortals there is a darkened place. A shadowed tree-line where no-one dares cross and whose boundaries go undisturbed.

This is not the woods of peaceful fey and beast, but the dark and twisted children’s tale that kept you full of terror. It is a world of fear, madness, and bloodshed; ruled over by the uncaring watch of ancient trees. There is no bargaining with the primal forces that rule the uncivilized world, as you have nothing they could ever want.

The woods do not care for you. Never forget that.

Into the Wyrd and Wild is a supplemental book for those seeking to incorporate a weird and terrifying wilderness into their role-playing game. Players and GMs who enjoy a level of horror and prefer the sweeping, darkened landscapes of forest and mires to the well-trodden cobblestone of dungeons need look no further when it comes to books. Presented within the book is a light overhaul of the adventuring system, modified to fit better with a campaign centered around forays into the frightening wilderness.

The book contains:


Rules for wilderness travel and survival
Rules for Moon Cycles and strange phases.
Rules for hunting, tracking, and butchering monsters.
40+ dangerous and terrifying monsters.
40+ strange and savage items.
40+ spells and rules for channeling the Wyrd.
An essay and guideline on running and creating "wilderness dungeons."
A step-by-step guide for generating your own wilderness adventure.
100 random wilderness locations.
Tables upon tables of random diseases, wilderness dressings, traps, hazards, flora, encounters, and MORE.


Whether you are a veteran group looking to make a foray into the terrifying Wilds, or new to the hobby and looking to spice up your game, Into the Wyrd and Wild provides something for everyone!

boardgame.name: The Plebian (Number I - May 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this number, our first adventure: The Lost Necklace - An Adventure for Character Levels 2-4

boardgame.name: Oh Really?
boardgame.description:
In this game created by visual artist MC Marquis, players try to correctly guess the order of preference of other players among 5 completely different topics. The more accurately your guesses are, the more points you score. Oh Really? brings laughter, discussions and small discomforts, all of which can be a great icebreaker for your dinners, parties or even on a date! With 200 different topics to choose from, each game will be unique and each choices can be hard to make.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Joystick Heroes
boardgame.description:
Joystick Heroes is a board game about playing video games - radical! Grab your friends and family and head to the arcade, where you’ll burn through tokens to play games and compete for the best scores. Each game tests different skillz, like your joystick agility or button-pressing prowess. Earn tickets, prizes, and power up your skillz. Kick butt on games in your favorite genre and win big by beating high scores. Challenge other wannabe heroes to 2-player games, grab a friend for co-op mode, and compete in arcade tournaments. The player with the most prizes when everybody’s out of tokens is the new Joystick Hero! Righteous!

At setup, create your arcade by laying out a number of Games cards. Each player starts with 10 arcade tokens. A round consists of 2 phases: (1) In the PLAY phase, choose any available Game card in your arcade, place 1 arcade token on it, and play it by rolling a number of dice based on the skills the game requires and your own skill levels. Use your hand of Power cards to boost your scores. Refer to the Top Scores chart and collect your winnings (tickets). (2) In the POWER UP phase, players spend the tickets they earned on skills upgrades or to purchase prizes.

When all players run out of arcade tokens, the player with the most prizes is the new Joystick Hero!

boardgame.name: Genjintsu no Kanojo wa Irimasen! (Real no Heroine wa Iremasen!)

The world that you are visiting this time is one much like your original one. A completely mundane Earth, with no supernatural elements, hidden or otherwise.

boardgame.name: Ironsmith
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This book includes the following supplements which have been edited more thoroughly, revised, and in some cases expanded:


New Assets
Corruptions
The Darkness Within
Vows and Milestones
Monster Hunting
New Foes
New Sites
Expanded Oracles

boardgame.name: The Rising City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this Epic event, an army of symbiont-enhanced soldiers guards the Emerald Claw as they excavate the daelkyr sanctuary beneath Metrol. To get past them, the adventurers need a diversion. A gang of scavengers camped in the city are willing to help, but they have their own demands—a long list of them, in fact! This four-hour Epic event is optimized for APL 16. Notes in the adventure allow for it to be used as a single-table event as well.
